page.title: 14MODERN BUILDINGS GODMERSHAM
page.content: Being an area of outstanding natural beauty little new building is allowed. The newest is Cort Lodge, built in georgian style, just outside the walls of Godmersham Park.Agricultural buildings at East Stour Farm and Pope Street have been converted into luxury homes. A rare example of a completely unmodernised farm can be seen at Hurst Farm beside the river Stour, without electricity and with the original oasts. In 1900 a public house stood at 7 Godmersham Park and the village once supported a shop, post office, school and forge. Sadly, along with the vicarage these have now become unusual but pleasant homes.
